result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra A Canfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 2 days sentence credit ($75 a day) to be applied to the fine. Balance of fine and costs are to be paid $100.00 a month commencing 01/15/23 and each month on the 15th thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Debra A Canfield

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:32 a.m.
Attorney Alissa Schaller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Debra A Canfield. 
Defendant Debra A Canfield appeared by video. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
Fine:  $804.50
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Defendant has 2-days jail credit - Court converts each day to $75.00 = $150.00 to be applied to the fine.*
Balance to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month, starting 1-15-2023 and the 15th of every month until paid in full.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to reside at the residence where Victim A lives. Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

1:09 PM Defendant Debra A Canfield in court, in custody. Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Debra A Canfield. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
